ResponseText: Actually, it was an incorrect understanding of the "laws" of aerodynamics the led to the belief that bumble bees couldn't fly. But that was decades ago. Seems typical of the science put forth by creationists. But, of course, scientific laws are only statements of what is observed. Once the concepts of vortex and dynamic stall were developed, it became clear that party calculations of aerodynamics were nonsense and the "laws" of aerodynamics were amended. Bumblebee flight does not violate any law of physics. It demonstrates the utmost ignorance for any creationist to cite this example in any debate about creationism v. evolution.
